name: Lazing on a Sunday Afternoon
wikiSummary: Lazing on a Sunday Afternoon was another song by Mercury. He played piano and did all of the vocals. The lead vocal was sung in studio, produced through headphones elsewhere in the studio in a tin bucket. A microphone picked up the sound from the bucket, which gives it a hollow "megaphone" sound. The guitar solo is also reported to have been recorded on the vocal track, as there were no more tracks to record on.
wikiText:
Lazing on a Sunday Afternoon was another song by Mercury. He played piano and did all of the vocals. The lead vocal was sung in studio, produced through headphones elsewhere in the studio in a tin bucket. A microphone picked up the sound from the bucket, which gives it a hollow "megaphone" sound. The guitar solo is also reported to have been recorded on the vocal track, as there were no more tracks to record on.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
album: A Night at the Opera / The Works
